overview_of_class: The concepts and practices of advanced object-oriented software design and development are covered in this course. Students' students' programming foundation is enhanced through study of advanced concepts behind object orientation, including role-based programming, advanced concepts of inheritance, interface development, design patterns, and test-driven development. Using this foundation, students learn the real-world aspects of object orientation by putting the concepts into practice and by using a contemporary object-oriented programming language and a database management system to develop a client-server application. :
name: Intermediate  Programming
title: SCS CIS 314-CN-14 Intermediate  Programming

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The concepts and practices of advanced object-oriented software design and development are covered in this course. Students' students' programming foundation is enhanced through study of advanced concepts behind object orientation, including role-based programming, advanced concepts of inheritance, interface development, design patterns, and test-driven development. Using this foundation, students learn the real-world aspects of object orientation by putting the concepts into practice and by using a contemporary object-oriented programming language and a database management system to develop a client-server application. :

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: CIS 212 or equivalent programming course. May not be audited or taken P/N.

subject: CIS
